comment: One of the best professors I have ever had. She is so kind, and makes her lectures so inclusive and interesting! Dr. Harris is an incredible person and gives so much understanding to the CJ field. Would 100% recommend!

Attendance is mandatory if you want to do good on quizzes. Her lectures are great and she allows us to ask questions. weekly quizzes, they are based off lectures. 2 case briefs, personally time consuming but it's good practice and the feedback is good as well. there is a midterm and final, an honest grader.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Attendance is not mandatory, but if you go you'll get extra credit and a great lecture! Brings relevant things into the lesson, and is very knowledgeable! Weekly quizzes and 4 tests (multiple choice & essay question) total all using lockdown browser. She's really funny and her lecture material is more important than the textbook in my opinion.

Dr. Harris is by far one of the greatest professors I've ever taken. Attendance is not mandatory however you do get extra credit at the end of the semester. There's a weekly quiz and a test every 5 chapters or so. The quizzes and tests are both online and are simple. I'd say take notes and study and show up to class. The test/quizzes are open note.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: by far my favorite prof. ive taken EVERY class she teaches here. mandatory attendance and strict on due dates but that's expected w college. challenges you to do your best.

There was weekly quizzes and a little more than halfway through the semster, we had a mock trial (which I enjoyed). I didn't go at all until it was time for the mock trial, because that's when attendance was mandatory since the trial was a huge chunk of our grade. The quizzes were really easy and I just used the powerpoints she had on d2l.

Easily one of the best professors/courses. Light workload: a weekly quiz, exam every few chapters, one written assignment, extra credit opportunities. Does not teach straight from powerpoints; uses real-life scenarios for better understanding. Respects students' opinions and answers all questions students may have.

Not sure why she doesnt have more reviews because she is AMAZING. She is very knowledgeable and makes her lectures interesting. Attendance is mandatory but she does post the power-points on D2L. A few extra credit opportunities. Weekly quizzes not lockdown. Exams are lockdown. Weekly hypos were hard and tough on grading, but gives good feedback.

There was weekly quizzes and a couple case studies, she grades attendance. The weekly quizzes are on lockdown but the final is lockdown with webcam. She posts textbook lectures. However in class she uses her own but does not post those for review, which is annoying. She has a lot of knowledge on the subject.

DO NOT TAKE HER CLASSES!
-this professor makes it almost impossible to succeed if you want an A
-does not post her lectures for students to review later, you have to rely on your notes in class so attendance is mandatory
-quizzes are on lockdown browser and the midterm and final in person
-does not answer emails
-does not care about students AT ALL
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Good prof overall. She is a very strict grader with the "hypothetical" assignments and discussion boards. Follow her guidelines, and you will do fine. The midterm and final both required Lockdown Browser/Webcam, but she did provide a study guide for both. Study the definitions from all chapters for those big tests! They are critical in succeeding.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT--Tough grader

comment: Harris was a good professor. Her grading system requires minimal assignments. There are a bunch of case studies to do, but they are super interesting. She can be a picky grader but follow her instructions clearly. Quizzes were easy. The final exam was a bit challenging and required Lockdown Browser. Very few discussions. She grades quickly/well.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Graded by few things--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Took 3300 with this professor. Easy grade as long as you do the work. She doesn't overwhelm you with online discussion posts. Some weeks you will a post and a quiz, other weeks you will only have a quiz, or a case study. Case studies can take some time and she likes the format to be APA. All quizzes are with respondous lockdown, final with webcam.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--So many papers

comment: By far one of my favorite professors. She's very relatable and understanding. She includes her own power points as well as the textbook's power points online. She's very informative and realistic, which made lectures enjoyable. Quizzes and hypotheticals were online. The midterm and final were both in person and as long as you study, you'll be fine.

Fun class of moderate difficulty. professor Harris is awesome, and gives great interactive lectures. Reading the textbook and taking good notes is an important part of doing good on the quizzes and final. The course cares to multiple leaning styles and with a quality effort no student should get worse than a B. Attendance and participation matters.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Amazing lectures

comment: Awesome professor and class. The environment created allowed for great in class discussions over criminal procedure. So long as you pay attention in class, take notes, and ask questions you should do well on the tests which are the largest portion of your grade. Participation is important and without attendance, you wont make an A.

Great professor. Professionalism will be graded meaning show up on time, participate in class discussion, and do not miss class without a VERY solid excuse. Shes a relaxed grader with not much of a courseload. If youre interested in all things Criminal Justice, take her classes. Theyre practically an easy A but you learn so much.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Professor Harris is my favorite criminal justice professor I have had so far definitely take her class if you're a criminal justice major and want to actually learn the course info. there's weekly quizzes and 5 or 6 case studies throughout the semester. come to class and read the book and you will have an A for sure! loved her for criminal courts.

Overall Jenae was a great teacher. She is extremely interesting and has a background in her field which makes for awesome stories. There is a quiz each week but they are easy if you take notes. No tests just the final. Few opportunities for extra credit. Definitely recommend her for any class she is teaching.
